main event: On July 26, 1949, a spinning, metallic-silver, saucer-shaped object about 25 feet in diameter and three to four feet thick was observed by a civilian and a witness in Mitchell, Nebraska. The object maintained a straight course towards the southwest at an estimated speed of 400 - 500 MPH, emitting a bright light thought to be the sun reflecting off its upper surface. The object was in view for about three minutes before disappearing behind a line of hills.
interesting points: The object emitted a bright light, later revealed to be the sun shining off its upper surfaces.
The witness described the object as looking like an upside-down saucer about 25 feet in diameter and three or four feet thick.
The saucer-shaped object was observed to be maintaining a straight course towards the southwest at a high estimated speed of 400 - 500 MPH.
The observation took place in clear weather conditions with light scattered clouds at 10,000 - 15,000 feet and a visibility of 40 miles.
The witness, identified as a physician and surgeon, was driving on the outer edge of town when attention was drawn by a bright light flashing in their eyes.
photographs: no photographs present in the report
